Package game

Class GameThreadSafe

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.ClassLoader
      • game.GameThreadSafe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class GameThreadSafe
extends java.lang.ClassLoader
implements java.io.Serializable
    Handles creating and interacting with the QWOP game world in Box2D. See GameConstants for all the system parameters.

    This loads all the Box2D classes needed on a unique ClassLoader. This means that World.class from one instance of this loader is different from the World.class of another loader. This means that they will have their own static variables and should not interfere with each other. This solves the problem of having multithreaded simulations that we don't want to interact with each other.

    Author:
    matt
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • stepGame

        public void stepGame​(boolean[] keys)
        Step the game forward 1 timestep with the specified keys pressed.
        Parameters:
        keys - 4 element array for whether the Q,W,O,P keys are pressed (true -> pressed).

      • getCurrentState

        public State getCurrentState()
        Get the current full state of the runner.

      • setState

        public void setState​(State state)
        Set the visible state of the runner (positions, velocities). Does not change the internal solver states, and can be a dangerous command to use. Determinism is out the window here.
        Parameters:
        state - State to set this game's runner at.

      • getXForms

        public java.lang.Object[] getXForms​(State st)
        Get the transform associated with this State. Note that these transforms can ONLY be used with this instance of GameThreadSafe.

      • getXForm

        public java.lang.Object getXForm​(StateVariable sv)
        Get the transform associated with this body's state variables. Note that these transforms can ONLY be used with this instance of GameThreadSafe.

      • adjustRealQWOPStateToSimState

        public static void adjustRealQWOPStateToSimState​(State realQWOPState)
        Take a state generated by the real Flash game and convert angles to work with my simulated version of QWOP.
        Parameters:
        realQWOPState - A state using angle offsets found in the real Flash QWOP game. This will be changed in place to have the offsets used in this simulated version.
